intro: Calyptrogyne pulchra, commonly known as the beautiful sea senna, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the Indo-Pacific. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in sandy or muddy soils near the shoreline. The plant produces yellow flowers with five petals, which are often clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are trifoliate, with three leaflets that are opposite and oval in shape. Calyptrogyne pulchra is adapted to saltwater environments and plays a role in stabilizing coastal ecosystems.
